summary.para: The Get method gets the current setting of a video property.

param.name: Property
param.para: Specifies the property to retrieve, as a value from the enumeration.

param.name: lValue
param.para: Receives the value of the property.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration. The returned value indicates whether the setting is controlled manually or automatically.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: The GetRange method gets the range and default value of a specified video property.

param.name: Property
param.para: Specifies the property to query, as a value from the enumeration.

param.name: pMin
param.para: Receives the minimum value of the property.

param.name: pMax
param.para: Receives the maximum value of the property.

param.name: pSteppingDelta
param.para: Receives the step size for the property. The step size is the smallest increment by which the property can change.

param.name: pDefault
param.para: Receives the default value of the property.

param.name: pCapsFlags
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration, indicating whether the property is controlled automatically or manually.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this property.

summary.para: The Set method sets video quality for a specified property.

param.name: Property
param.para: The property to set, specified as a enumeration value.

param.name: lValue
param.para: The new value of the property.

param.name: Flags
param.para: The desired control setting, specified as a enumeration value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the pCapsFlags parameter is VideoProcAmp_Flags_Auto, the lValue parameter is ignored.

summary.para: The IAMVideoProcAmp interface adjusts the qualities of an incoming video signal, such as brightness, contrast, hue, saturation, gamma, and sharpness.
The WDM Video Capture filter exposes this interface if the hardware supports image adjustment.

remarks.para: For Windows Driver Model (WDM) devices, the WDM Video Capture Filter automatically exposes this interface if the WDM driver supports the PROPSETID_VIDCAP_VIDEOPROCAMP property set. For more information, see the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) documentation.
